trans-unit.source: How to install and configure Trend Micro Deep Security as a Service on an Azure VM | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to install and configure Trend Micro Deep Security as a Service on an Azure VM | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to install and configure Trend Micro security on a VM in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to install and configure Trend Micro security on a VM in Azure.

trans-unit.source: How to install and configure Trend Micro Deep Security as a Service on an Azure VM
trans-unit.target: How to install and configure Trend Micro Deep Security as a Service on an Azure VM

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to install and configure Trend Micro Deep Security as a Service on a new or existing virtual machine (VM) running Windows Server.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to install and configure Trend Micro Deep Security as a Service on a new or existing virtual machine (VM) running Windows Server.

trans-unit.source: Deep Security as a Service includes anti-malware protection, a firewall, an intrusion prevention system, and integrity monitoring.
trans-unit.target: Deep Security as a Service includes anti-malware protection, a firewall, an intrusion prevention system, and integrity monitoring.

trans-unit.source: Note that this article refers to the virtual machines created using the classic deployment model.
trans-unit.target: Note that this article refers to the virtual machines created using the classic deployment model.

trans-unit.source: The client is installed as a security extension via the VM Agent.
trans-unit.target: The client is installed as a security extension via the VM Agent.

trans-unit.source: On a new virtual machine, you'll install the VM Agent along with the Deep Security Agent.
trans-unit.target: On a new virtual machine, you'll install the VM Agent along with the Deep Security Agent.

trans-unit.source: On an existing virtual machine that doesn't have the VM Agent, you'll need to download and install it first.
trans-unit.target: On an existing virtual machine that doesn't have the VM Agent, you'll need to download and install it first.

trans-unit.source: This article covers both situations.
trans-unit.target: This article covers both situations.

trans-unit.source: If you have existing subscription from Trend Micro for an on-premises solution, you can use it to help protect your Azure virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: If you have existing subscription from Trend Micro for an on-premises solution, you can use it to help protect your Azure virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: If you're not a customer yet, you can sign up for a trial subscription.
trans-unit.target: If you're not a customer yet, you can sign up for a trial subscription.

trans-unit.source: For more information about this solution, see the Trend Micro blog post <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure VM Agent Extension For Deep Security</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about this solution, see the Trend Micro blog post <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure VM Agent Extension For Deep Security</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Install the Deep Security Agent on a new virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Install the Deep Security Agent on a new virtual machine

trans-unit.source: The Azure portal lets you install the VM Agent and the Trend Micro security extension when you use the From Gallery option to create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The Azure portal lets you install the VM Agent and the Trend Micro security extension when you use the From Gallery option to create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Using this approach is an easy way to add protection from Trend Micro if you're creating a single virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Using this approach is an easy way to add protection from Trend Micro if you're creating a single virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This From Gallery option opens a wizard that helps you set up the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This From Gallery option opens a wizard that helps you set up the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You use the last page of the wizard to install the VM Agent and Trend Micro security extension.
trans-unit.target: You use the last page of the wizard to install the VM Agent and Trend Micro security extension.

trans-unit.source: For general instructions, see <link><linkText>Create a virtual machine running Windows in the Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For general instructions, see <link><linkText>Create a virtual machine running Windows in the Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: When you get to the last page of the wizard, do the following:
trans-unit.target: When you get to the last page of the wizard, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Under VM Agent, check Install VM Agent.
trans-unit.target: Under VM Agent, check Install VM Agent.

trans-unit.source: Under Security Extensions, check Trend Micro Deep Security Agent.
trans-unit.target: Under Security Extensions, check Trend Micro Deep Security Agent.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install the VM Agent and the Deep Security Agent</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install the VM Agent and the Deep Security Agent</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Install the Deep Security Agent on an existing virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Install the Deep Security Agent on an existing virtual machine

trans-unit.source: To do this, you'll need the following:
trans-unit.target: To do this, you'll need the following:

trans-unit.source: The Azure PowerShell module, version 0.8.2 or newer, installed on your local computer.
trans-unit.target: The Azure PowerShell module, version 0.8.2 or newer, installed on your local computer.

trans-unit.source: You can check the version of Azure PowerShell that you have installed by using the Get-Module azure | format-table version command.
trans-unit.target: You can check the version of Azure PowerShell that you have installed by using the Get-Module azure | format-table version command.

trans-unit.source: For instructions and a link to the latest version, see <link><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions and a link to the latest version, see <link><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The VM Agent installed on the target virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The VM Agent installed on the target virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: First, verify that the VM Agent is already installed. Fill in the cloud service name and virtual machine name, and then run the following commands at an administrator-level Azure PowerShell command prompt. Replace everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters.
trans-unit.target: First, verify that the VM Agent is already installed. Fill in the cloud service name and virtual machine name, and then run the following commands at an administrator-level Azure PowerShell command prompt. Replace everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters.

trans-unit.source: If you don't know the cloud service and virtual machine name, run Get-AzureVM to display that information for all the virtual machines in your current subscription.
trans-unit.target: If you don't know the cloud service and virtual machine name, run Get-AzureVM to display that information for all the virtual machines in your current subscription.

trans-unit.source: If the write-host command returns True, the VM Agent is installed.
trans-unit.target: If the write-host command returns True, the VM Agent is installed.

trans-unit.source: If it returns False, see the instructions and a link to the download in the Azure blog post VM Agent and Extensions - Part 2.
trans-unit.target: If it returns False, see the instructions and a link to the download in the Azure blog post VM Agent and Extensions - Part 2.

trans-unit.source: If the VM Agent is installed, run these commands.
trans-unit.target: If the VM Agent is installed, run these commands.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: It takes a few minutes for the agent to start running when it is installed.
trans-unit.target: It takes a few minutes for the agent to start running when it is installed.

trans-unit.source: After that, you'll need to activate Deep Security on the virtual machine so it can be managed by a Deep Security Manager.
trans-unit.target: After that, you'll need to activate Deep Security on the virtual machine so it can be managed by a Deep Security Manager.

trans-unit.source: See the following for additional instructions:
trans-unit.target: See the following for additional instructions:

trans-unit.source: Trend's article about this solution, <link><linkText>Instant-On Cloud Security for Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: Trend's article about this solution, <link><linkText>Instant-On Cloud Security for Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: A <link><linkText>sample Windows PowerShell script</linkText><title></title></link> to configure the virtual machine
